TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Equalizer extends Android.Media.Audiofx.AudioEffect

Docs.summary: An Equalizer is used to alter the frequency response of a particular music source or of the main output mix.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 priority, int32 audioSession) cil managed

Docs.param: the priority level requested by the application for controlling the Equalizer engine. As the same engine can be shared by several applications, this parameter indicates how much the requesting application needs control of effect parameters. The normal priority is 0, above normal is a positive number, below normal a negative number.
system wide unique audio session identifier. The Equalizer will be attached to the MediaPlayer or AudioTrack in the same audio session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int16 GetBand(int32 frequency) cil managed
abstract member GetBand : int -> int16 override this.GetBand : int -> int16

Docs.param: frequency in milliHertz which is to be equalized via the returned band.
Docs.summary: Gets the band that has the most effect on the given frequency.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32[] GetBandFreqRange(int16 band) cil managed
abstract member GetBandFreqRange : int16 -> int[] override this.GetBandFreqRange : int16 -> int[]

Docs.param: frequency band whose frequency range is requested. The numbering of the bands starts from 0 and ends at (number of bands - 1).
Docs.summary: Gets the frequency range of the given frequency band.

Docs.param: frequency band whose gain is requested. The numbering of the bands starts from 0 and ends at (number of bands - 1).
Docs.summary: Gets the gain set for the given equalizer band.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetBandLevel (short band, short level);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetBandLevel(int16 band, int16 level) cil managed
abstract member SetBandLevel : int16 * int16 -> unit override this.SetBandLevel : int16 * int16 -> unit

Docs.param: frequency band that will have the new gain. The numbering of the bands starts from 0 and ends at (number of bands - 1).
new gain in millibels that will be set to the given band. getBandLevelRange() will define the maximum and minimum values.
Docs.summary: Sets the given equalizer band to the given gain value.
